intro: Stolzia thomensis, commonly known as the Cape Stolzia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with smooth, grey-green leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for coastal gardens. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is also valued for its role in supporting local pollinators.
